subject: Re: [junit] JUnit 4 && Eclipse > 3.0?
msgSnippet: Thomas, Eclipse 3.1 will run JUnit 4 tests if they are wrapped in a compatibility suite, like so: public class MyTest { @Test public void count() { // hmm hmm
messageBody:
Thomas,

Eclipse 3.1 will run JUnit 4 tests if they are wrapped in a
compatibility suite, like so:

public class MyTest {
@Test public void count() {
// hmm hmm hmm...
}

static public junit.framework.Test suite() {
return new JUnit4TestAdapter(MyTest.class);
}
}

This should run just fine, with the hierarchy displaying as usual.
There is a bug that prevents you from using right-click and "Rerun" from
the JUnit view if the test being rerun is JUnit 4. Run As > JUnit*
should work as before.

The Eclipse JDT UI team is planning to have better native JUnit 4
support in an upcoming 3.2 milestone (currently, M3).

If any part of this ends up being false, please post a bug over at
http://dev.eclipse.org Thanks,

David Saff
